intro: Myosotis ucrainica, commonly known as the Ukrainian forget-me-not, is a flowering plant native to Eastern Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its delicate blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors or along stream banks. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are slender and often trailing. The flowers bloom in early summer and are pollinated primarily by bees and other insects.
